result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Raymond A Hodgkins in court with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM591 and 15CM602.  Rights/Elements.  In 15CM602 Defendant pled no contest to Cts. 2 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 Dismissed but read in.  15CM591 Dismissed but read in.  In 15CM602 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 18 months.  Conditions of probation include:  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit DNA sample.  Continue psychological treatment and comply.  Ct. 2 $443.00 costs.  Ct.3 343.00 costs.  12 days jail credit.  Defendant is not to be monitored as a sex offender while on probation.
Return date on November 9, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon, requesting a new return date due schedule conflict with defendant.
Return date on October 13, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Filed by Attorney Tristan Eagon, requesting a reset of the return date today due - she has been called to serve jury duty in Dane County.
Return date on October 3, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
